free.chess
Class Piece

java.lang.Object
  free.chess.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChessPiece
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object

The superclass of all classes representing pieces in wild chess variants.

Field Detail

WHITE

public static final int WHITE
A constant representing a white piece.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

BLACK

public static final int BLACK
A constant representing a black piece.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

val

protected int val
An integer representing the piece. Negative values are black pieces and positive are white pieces. The absolute value of this variable is the type of the piece. Thus, the value of this integer is color*type;

Constructor Detail

Piece

protected Piece(int color,
                int type)
Creates a Piece of the given color and type.

Parameters:
color - The color of the piece, either Piece.WHITE or Piece.BLACK
type - The type of the piece, 0 is not allowed.
Method Detail

isOppositeColor

public boolean isOppositeColor(Piece piece)
Returns true if the given Piece has opposite color from this piece.

isSameColor

public boolean isSameColor(Piece piece)
Returns trie of the given Piece has the same color as this Piece.

getPlayer

public Player getPlayer()
Returns the Player this piece belongs to.

getColor

public int getColor()
Returns the color of this Piece, either BLACK or WHITE.

isWhite

public boolean isWhite()
Returns true if this Piece is white, returns false otherwise.

isBlack

public boolean isBlack()
Returns true if this Piece is black, returns false otherwise.

toShortString

public abstract java.lang.String toShortString()
Returns a short (notational) string representing this chess piece ("N" for a knight for example). Black and white pieces should be represented by the same string. To differentiate between black and white pieces, use the toShortColorString method.

Returns:
a short string representing this piece.

toShortColorString

public java.lang.String toShortColorString()
Returns the same as toShortString() only lowercase for black pieces and uppercase for white ones.

getColorName

public java.lang.String getColorName()
Returns a string representing the color of this piece, "White" for a white piece and "Black" for a black piece. Returns "Colorless" for the empty piece.

getTypeName

public abstract java.lang.String getTypeName()
Returns a string representing the type of this piece ("Knight" for a knight for example).

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this chess piece. Returns "Empty" for the empty piece.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns the hashcode of this Piece.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
Returns true if the given Piece is the same as this one. This returns true if and only if the type (class) of this piece is the same as the type of the given piece and their "piece" values are the same. Subclasses implementing singleton pieces should override this and compare by reference.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
